meanings.definition: A person who continually thinks about something to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The obsessors in the class couldn't stop talking about their favorite video game.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends were known as the obsessors of fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The obsessors at the party kept discussing the same movie over and over again.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a room full of obsessors, fixated on one thought.
meanings.sent5: The obsessors in the office were always gossiping about the latest news.

meanings.definition: A group or organization that constantly fixates on a particular topic or idea.
meanings.sent1: The media company became known as the obsessors of celebrity scandals.
meanings.sent2: The obsessors of conspiracy theories gathered every week to discuss new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The obsessors at the book club only wanted to read mystery novels.
meanings.sent4: The city council was like a group of obsessors, always focused on budget cuts.
meanings.sent5: The obsessors in the neighborhood association were determined to repaint all the houses.
